message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to offer you this amazing product. It's a great opportunity for you to get your hands on this valuable item. I'm willing to sell it to you for $60.
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $50. Would you be willing to meet me halfway?

I understand you're interested in the product, but I'm not willing to go as low as $50. I'm willing to meet you halfway from my original offer, so I'm counteroffering at $65. It's a fair price considering the product's value.
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but I'm still a bit above my budget. I'd be willing to pay $57.50 for the product. Would you be open to meeting me at this price?

I understand you're trying to stay within your budget, but I'm not willing to go as low as $57.50. I'm willing to make another concession, so I'm counteroffering at $62.50. This is the lowest I'm willing to go, considering the product's value.
I appreciate your willingness to make another concession, but I'm still a bit above my budget. I'd be willing to pay $59.50 for the product. Would you be open to meeting me at this price?

I'm starting to get a bit frustrated with the back-and-forth, but I'm still willing to negotiate. I'm willing to make one more concession, so I'm counteroffering at $64. This is the final offer I'm willing to make.
I understand that you're willing to make one more concession, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'd be willing to pay $61 for the product. This is my final offer.
I'm not willing to go as low as $61. I've already made several concessions, and I think this product is worth more than that. I'm willing to make one final offer: $66. This is my absolute limit.
I understand that you're willing to make one final offer, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I've decided to stop negotiating and will buy the product from John for $80 instead.
